intro: Ophryosporus galioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tansy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant has linear, narrow leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are yellow, clustered in dense, flat-topped inflorescences. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Ophryosporus galioides is known for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
